titleInfo.title: Letter, John Watkins in Knoxville, Tenn. to Sarah Probert in Pittsfield, Ohio, 1863 October 6

mods.abstract: In this letter, dated October 6, 1863, from John Watkins in Knoxville, Tenn., to Sarah Probert in Pittsfield, Ohio, Watkins describes daily life in camp, providing details of two recent funerals, one of a Captain and the other of a Private, complaining of the bigger scale of the former. He also describes a local, Knoxville-area custom: "I guess that I never have told you of a peculiar habit that almost universally exists among the people here and that is the use of tobacco and snuff, among the women and children as the men."
